thinking.disposable_income: Mixed-income community with 43.5% making $100k+ but also 32.6% under $50k. About 15.6% are low-income (<$25k), suggesting need to be mindful of transit costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution, many residents have moderate to high discretionary spending power, but significant portion needs to watch transportation costs. Sales tax impact varies significantly across income groups
thinking.accessibility: Good mix of transportation options - 19.8% no car, 48.2% one car. 21.5% use transit and 49.7% drive alone for commuting. Need balance between transit service quality and costs
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize proposals balancing moderate taxes with improved transit times given mixed income levels. 2. Consider high transit usage (21.5%) and car-free households (19.8%). 3. Moderate driving fees acceptable as 72.9% have 1+ cars. 4. Lower fares important for lower-income residents. 5. Selected proposals that reduce transit times without excessive cost burden. Ranked based on best overall benefit-cost ratio for community's mixed needs
